answers.answer: Dear Katjoy ~I am sorry to hear of your numerous health issues and commend you for searching for answers.  This forum is moderated by volunteers, not medical professionals.  The issues you have mentioned are best discussed with a health team who is familiar with all of your symptoms and your personal health background and I would urge you to get a thorough work up to see if the doc's can determine the cause(s) of your problems.  I wish I could be of more help . . . maybe someone will visit this forum and be able to offer you something more.  In the meantime, see your doctors and do your best to keep your blood sugars under control as out-of-control levels can cause things like that absessed tooth to take longer to heal.  I wish you the best . . . please let us know how you're doing!  JHG

question: I have type 1 diabetes, newly diagnosed in November 03.  My dr thinks I have had it, undiagnosed for a few years.  I think there are some lasting effects from it.  The base of my spine, and my neck area give me problems, and seem to come and go, but get worse.  At times, I feel like I'm going to faint, unless I get circulation moving, and cannot sit in my car and drive well, especially for a long time.I do have an abscessed tooth, of which I am taking clindamycin (an antibiotic) until it can get pulled and insurance dictates what they will cover to replace the tooth (former root canal gone bad).  This condition is very scary.  I am wondering if I should get an MRI of my head, as I also have headaches on that same side, which come and go for about the last five years.  My dad and my aunt both died of subarachnoid hemmorhages (brain aneurisyms), so that is also making me worried.  I have to move my head to one side, and arch my back to feel like the circulation is going to my head.My blood sugars have been fairly stabilized (when I don't try to cheat!), and I have checked my blood sugar when these episodes occur, and they are usually where they should be, so I don't think this is blood sugar related.Can anyone help me?
title: what is happening to me?
